title: Level 7 Statistics and Probability Practice Test
description: Test your skills with mean, median, mode, range, stem-and-leaf plots, histograms, sample spaces, and tree diagrams.

questions.question: The data set is $3, 7, 7, 10, 13$. What is the range?
In a stem-and-leaf plot, the row '$5 | 2 \; 4 \; 7$' (with key $5|2 = 52$) represents which values?
questions.explanation: The stem is $5$ (tens digit) and the leaves are $2, 4, 7$ (units digits). So the values are $52, 54, 57$.

questions.question: A coin is flipped and a die is rolled. How many outcomes are in the sample space?
questions.explanation: Coin has $2$ outcomes, die has $6$ outcomes. Total $= 2 \times 6 = 12$.

questions.question: Two coins are flipped. What is the probability of getting two Tails?
questions.explanation: Using a tree diagram: $P(TT) = \frac{1}{2} \times \frac{1}{2} = \frac{1}{4}$. The sample space $\{HH, HT, TH, TT\}$ has $4$ equally likely outcomes, and only $1$ is $TT$.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a feature of a histogram?

options.text: Each bar represents a single data point

questions.explanation: In a histogram, each bar represents an **interval** (range of values), not a single data point. The bars touch because the data is continuous.

questions.question: A spinner has sections Red (prob $\frac{1}{4}$), Blue (prob $\frac{1}{2}$), and Green (prob $\frac{1}{4}$). It is spun twice. What is the probability of getting Blue both times?
questions.explanation: $P(\text{Blue and Blue}) = \frac{1}{2} \times \frac{1}{2} = \frac{1}{4}$. We multiply probabilities along the branches of a tree diagram.

questions.question: A data set has values $4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14$. What is the median?
questions.explanation: There are $6$ values (even count). The two middle values are the 3rd ($8$) and 4th ($10$). Median $= \frac{8 + 10}{2} = 9$.

questions.question: A die is rolled and a coin is flipped. What is the probability of rolling an even number AND getting Heads? Give your answer as a fraction.
The data set is $12, 15, 15, 18, 20, 22, 25$. What is the range?
